member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.IFileService
member.summary: Provides remote access to the file system of the current workspace.
member.remarks:
All paths are relative to one or more workspace root directories. If the workspace has multiple roots, the root name comes before the first slash in the path. (The root name is NOT prefixed with a slash.) / Unnamed (single) root directory /file.txt File in the unnamed root directory /dir/file.txt File in a subdirectory under the unnamed root root2 Named root directory root2/file.txt File in a named root directory
Most APIs have optional options. When an options argument is unspecified/null, it is equivalent to options with all default values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.IFileService.RegisterExternalFilesAsync(System.String[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Adds a set of external files to the collaboration session. The vsls path is generated by the client-side path converter, and is simply cached here. This method can be called only by the host client. Dictionary maps local paths to vsls paths: e.g., {"C:/Users/Caitlin/webapp/banana" : "/~external/a1b2c3/banana"}

member.summary:
Configures a forwarding stream provider in to start forwarding to localhost: tcp socket. Use the result's and to get a stream from
which would wrap the network stream to the socket. If the port is already forwarded, is ignored.
member.param: Local tcp port to connect to. Not 0 or negative.
Port forwarding session name. Not null or empty.
Browser URL if the server is a browser session.
member.returns: Shared local server info, not null.

member.summary:
Configures a forwarding stream provider in to start forwarding to local pipe . Use the result's and to get a stream from
which would wrap the network stream to the pipe. If the pipe is already forwarded, is ignored.
member.param: Local pipe name to connect to 0. Not null or empty.
Pipe forwarding session name. Not null or empty.
A value indicating whether Server Sharing Service will send a ClientAccessInfo off the RPC context to the pipe when a guest connects to it.
member.returns: Shared local pipe info, not null.

member.summary: The resource path and version specify a source-controlled resource that may only exists in source control, e.g. some file or folder at specific revision. The resource can be fetched via ISourceControlService.GetSourceControlResource(). The resource is read-only. The path is source-control specific and does not necessarily translates to a file path.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.SourceControlResourceType.WorkspaceWithSpecificVersion
member.summary: The resource path points to a file or folder within the collaboration workspace. It corresponds to vsls: scheme. The difference from Workspace is that this resource also specifies version.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.IWorkspaceService.RegisterServicesAsync(System.String[],Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.CollectionChangeType,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Registers or unregisters service proxies that enable the client to provide RPC services to other clients in the workspace.
member.remarks:
Other clients can make RPC requests to the registered services by name without knowing details about exactly who is providing each service. (Services can still be provided by the agent also.) Services registered by clients can also raise events, which then get broadcast as RPC notification messages to any other clients that are listening for events from the service. (Where broadcast functionality is not needed, consider using a request instead of events; requests and responses are never broadcast.)
If there are multiple instances of the same service, RPC requests to that service may result in an error when a single service provider cannot be identified. (But when are 2 providers of a service and the caller is one of them, then the request is delivered to the non-caller provider, because there are no loopback requests so there is no ambiguity.) However, multiple instances of a service may all broadcast notifications without limitations.
The client must separately register the service implementation(s) on its RPC session. Also before invoking this method, a current workspace must have been already set via a share or join request. The registrations only last as long as the current workspace sesssion.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.ConnectionMode
member.summary: Defines the ways that an RPC caller can connect to a workspace when joining.
member.remarks: Changes to this enum may require corresponding updates to the available values offered for users to select in client settings.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.ConnectionMode.Auto
member.summary: Try connecting directly, if that fails then try connecting via a relay.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.ConnectionMode.Direct
member.summary: Direct (peer-to-peer) TCP connection; may be on the same local network, through VPN, or through NAT traversal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.ConnectionMode.Relay
member.summary: Connection through a cloud relay server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.ConnectionMode.Local
member.summary: Indicates the workspace to be joined is one that is hosted locally by the agent being called; the callee must not forward the join request to another remote agent.
member.remarks: This mode is not to be specified by a user, therefore it should be hidden from user settings. It is used internally based on application or agent logic when the target workspace is known to be hosted by the agent being called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.WorkspaceListOptions.IncludeRemoteWorkspaces
member.summary: Optionally include remote workspaces.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.WorkspaceSessionInfo.SessionNumber
member.summary: Integer that identifies the session with the workspace, guaranteed to be unique across all other sessions connected to the same workspace at the same time.
member.remarks: Session numbers are assigned by the workspace hosting agent. They are valid for the duration of a collaboration session, not for the extended lifetime a workspace. That means if a workspace owner stops sharing and then later re-shares the same workspace, the session numbers may be different (and numbers may be re-used from past sharing sessions).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.WorkspaceSessionInfo.ConversationId
member.summary: String that identifies the collective shared workspace conversation that's happening across all participants.
member.remarks: Conversation ID is set by the cloud services whenever the owner shares a workspace or re-joins a workspace that they previously shared. The conversation ID is then shared across all parties that connect to the workspace (both owner and participants) in order to correlate the telemetry events emitted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IOperationAccessClient
member.summary: Guest service helping with operation access elevation. If a restricted operation is rejected due to insufficient access, VsAccessControlService on that guest will query the appropriate on the operation name. VsAccessControlService will use IOperationAccessClient to get the message, and will display the message to the user asking if they want to query the host for elevation. If the guest user agrees to request elevation, VsAccessControlService will follow the request to the host, and when the host user either agrees or denies the request, will display the appropriate message to the guest.
member.remarks: Implementation must be attributed with .

member.summary: Gets a message for the guest telling that they have no access to .

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the message about insufficient access is verbose or not. Verbose messages may be suppressed via Tools -> Options -> Live Share setting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IOperationAccessClient.GetPermissionGrantedMessage(Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.RestrictedOperation)
member.summary: Gets a message for the guest telling that the host has granted access to perform . May be null. If null, no message will be displayed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IOperationAccessClient.GetPermissionDeniedMessage(Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.RestrictedOperation)
member.summary: Gets a message for the guest telling that the host has rejected access to perform . May be null. If null, no message will be displayed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IOperationAccessManager
member.summary:
Host service helping with operation access elevation. If a guest requested access to a restricted operation, VsWorkspaceAccessControlService on the host will query the appropriated based on the operation name. It'll use it to check if the access to operation is already granted, and if not, what is the message to dispaly to the host user. The message will have "Allow", "Allow All" and "Dismiss" action with it. If the host choses "Allow All", VsWorkspaceAccessControlService will call
to permanently grant the permission. If the host choses "Allow" or "Dismiss", VsWorkspaceAccessControlService will honor the choice till the end of the current collaboration session.
member.remarks: Implementation must be attributed with .

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether operation access can be granted, given the current (disallowed) access.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.LiveShare.IOperationAccessManager.IsOperationAccessGranted(Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.RestrictedOperation)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to is already granted.

member.summary: Gets a message to display to the host when a guest user with session and name requests access to .

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a message to request permission to is verbose. Verbose messages may be suppressed via Tools -> Options -> Live Share setting.
